source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Brassicaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Brassicaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Fruits erect (pedicels closely appressed to flowering stem) and conical
Petals 6–10 mm long; at least lower leaves conspicuously hairy with soft, spreading and/or reflexed hairs
Petals less than 4 mm long; plant glabrous or with scattered hairs
Fruit straight, more or less horizontal; pedicels thick, 2–3 mm long
Fruit curved, spreading; pedicels slender, 6–10 mm long
